title: BRS MLA Maganti Gopinath passes away
content: He suffered cardiac arrest on June 5, was admitted to a corporate hospital, survived by wife and three children

title: Kavalam-Thattassery bridge: revised estimate gets KIIFB nod
content: Though land acquisition completed in 2023, delay in receiving final nod from KIIFB had stalled the project

title: BJP replying to Rahul's Maharashtra poll questions instead of EC confirms match-fixing: Chennithala
content: Top BJP leaders, including party chief J.P. Nadda, had slammed Mr. Gandhi for casting aspersions on the country's electoral process

title: Illegal banners continue to pose safety risk to the public on main roads of Tiruchi
content: Although a no-objection certificate from the Corporation, the police, and the district administration is mandatory for putting up hoardings, this rule is followed more in the breach

title: Government urged to reintroduce Telugu medium to protect interest of students and teachers
content: It will protect the interests of the students hailing from rural areas as they cannot understand lessons taught in English in the initial stages, says HRF Viziangaram district convener

title: Watch: Justice Yashwant Varma impeachment motion | Causes and way forward
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we will discuss what led to the impeachment motion and the way forward

title: Textbook on knowledge systems: Calicut varsity to take decision on June 11
content: The textbook brought out by the Kerala State Higher Education Council covers the State’s traditional knowledge, including cultural practices, oral narratives, performing arts, and documented literary sources

title: Manipur Governor holds security review meeting amid protests over Meitei outfit leaders' arrest
content: A Raj Bhavan statement said the Governor also met a delegation of MLAs who apprised Bhalla of the current law and order situation in the state

title: Vazhikkadavu boy’s electrocution exposes dangers of power theft
content: A live wire, siphoned from an overhead power line, was recklessly placed in the canal, creating a deadly electric shock hazard for any living being that touched the water

title: ₹11 crore sanctioned for works of two NHs between Annamayya and Kadapa districts: Minister
content: The construction of cement roads and drainage canals will also be undertaken on top priority, says Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy

title: In 2026, NDA will form governments in Tamil Nadu, West Bengal: Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah predicts NDA victory in Tamil Nadu and West Bengal, aiming to dislodge DMK from power in 2026

title: Boy’s electrocution ignites political fire in Nilambur bypoll
content: Tragic death of 15-year-old boy sparks political turmoil and protests in Nilambur, Kerala as byelection nears.

title: CBI arrests Meitei outfit Arambai Tenggol activist from Imphal airport
content: CBI arrests Arambai Tenggol member in Manipur, shifts trials to Guwahati due to ethnic violence, sparking protests in Imphal

title: Constitutional bodies ‘hijacked’ under Modi Government, alleges Tejashwi Yadav
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal leader claims the last state Assembly polls held in 2020 were not held fairly and backed doubts raised by Rahul Gandhi of alliance partner Congress over Maharashtra elections

title: Judge's mangalsutra snatched from Mathura temple, 10 women thieves arrested
content: Police recovered several stolen purses belonging to both men and women, containing cash, Aadhaar cards, PAN cards, debit cards, driving licenses, and other important documents, along with a total of ₹18,652 in cash

title: PM Modi lacks courage to have ‘undoctored’ press meets: Congress
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh accuses PM Modi of “scripting” media interactions, lacking “courage for undoctored press” meets unlike predecessors

title: Chirag Paswan slams Congress-RJD, skips to mention name of to contest upcoming Assembly poll
content: During the ‘Nav Sankalp Mahasabha’, Chirag Paswan slammed the previous regime of Congress and Rashtriya Janata Dal while praising heap on ruling NDA governments for developments.

title: Rahul Gandhi dismissing mandate of people as they rejected him: Fadnavis
content: In a post on ‘X’, Mr. Gandhi outlined the alleged electoral irregularities in a stepwise manner — fake voters are added, voter turnout is inflated, bogus voting is facilitated, and evidence is subsequently hidden.

title: This year on, students in Tamil Nadu’s Adi Dravidar hostels to receive TAHDCO’s Polivu personal care kits
content: Each Polivu kit contains four bath soaps, hair wash shampoo, coconut oil, detergent powder, detergent soap, a toothbrush and toothpaste. The kits will be distributed thrice a year.

title: 16 arrested in Assam for illegal cattle slaughter during Eid-ul-Adha
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said preserving communal harmony cannot be at the cost of lawlessness or cruelty

title: Cash discovery row: Resignation only option before Justice Varma to avoid removal by Parliament
content: According to Article 217 of the Constitution, a high court judge "may, by writing under his hand addressed to the President, resign his office."

title: About 2,500 acres of land will be required for 271-km circular railway network in Bengaluru
content: Union Minister of State for Railways plans 271-km circular railway network in Bengaluru to ease traffic congestion and improve mobility

title: Exclusion of Arunachal weightlifter from Commonwealth trials slammed
content: The Arunachal Olympic Association has petitioned the Indian Olympic Association against the snub to consistent gold medal winner Sambo Lapung

title: Write to EC formally: Poll panel sources on Rahul seeking reply on election rigging claim
content: EC had invited all six national parties for separate interactions. While the other five met the EC brass, Congress cancelled the May 15 meeting.

title: Telangana Cabinet expansion: A calculated move towards social justice
content: Telangana Cabinet expansion prioritises social justice with representation from marginalised communities, setting the stage for political evolution.

title: Telangana Cabinet expanded with inclusion of Vivek Venkataswamy, Vakiti Srihari and Adluri Lakshman Kumar
content: CM Revanth Reddy prefered striking social balance in Cabinet expansion; strength of Telangana Cabinet reached 13.

title: Op Sindoor: Another Pak lie exposed; satellite images debunk claim it hit India's Adampur airbase
content: Following Operation Sindoor, Pakistan propagated false claims of victory against India, using doctored images to suggest successful strikes on Indian airfields. However, independent analysis has debunked these assertions, revealing that images were either pre-dated, misinterpreted, or digitally altered. The evidence confirms no significant damage to Indian assets, contrasting with India's successful strikes on Pakistani military sites.

title: 'I cannot defeat DMK but...': Shah challenges Stalin as BJP gears up for TN polls
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, addressing a rally in Madurai, asserted that while Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin believes Shah cannot defeat the DMK, the people of Tamil Nadu will ensure the DMK's loss in the upcoming assembly elections. Shah expressed confidence in a BJP-AIADMK alliance victory.

title: Goa CM overturns health min's order to suspend doctor as video sparks row
content: Goa's health minister Vishwajit Rane initially ordered the suspension of Dr Rudresh Kurtikar at Goa Medical College and Hospital after a video went viral showing Rane confronting the doctor about patient care. However, Chief Minister Pramod Sawant intervened, assuring the public that Dr Kurtikar would not be suspended.

title: 'Turn back': Israel orders military to block Gaza-bound aid boat carrying Greta Thunberg
content: Greta Thunberg and other activists are sailing to Gaza with aid, but Israel has vowed to prevent their entry, citing the need to maintain its naval blockade against Hamas. The Freedom Flotilla Coalition's vessel, Madleen, aims to deliver humanitarian assistance and highlight the worsening crisis in the region, despite previous attempts facing setbacks and accusations of Israeli attacks.

title: Tech jobs: Microsoft CEO's advice for Computer Science students; 'All of us..'
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella advises aspiring tech professionals to prioritize computational thinking fundamentals, even with AI's growing influence. He emphasizes the importance of logically breaking down problems and designing systematic solutions. Nadella also revealed that AI now contributes significantly to Microsoft's code, writing up to 30% of it.

title: India's economy overtaking Japan no reason to be smug: WEF ex-MD
content: India is poised to surpass Japan as the fourth-largest economy, but World Economic Forum’s (WEF) former MD Claude Smadja cautions against complacency, citing the country's low per capita GDP compared to Japan. He emphasizes the need for reforms to improve living conditions.

title: 'I will contest Bihar polls': Chirag Paswan ends speculation
content: Chirag Paswan announced his decision to contest the upcoming Bihar assembly elections, emphasizing his commitment to fulfilling his father's vision and prioritizing the state's development. He stated that the people of Bihar will decide which constituency he will contest from, clarifying that his aim is to improve his party's performance within the NDA coalition.

title: Tim Cook recalls Steve Jobs’ lesson: Says Jobs taught him to change mind quickly; Feels very thankful
content: Tim Cook credits Steve Jobs with teaching him the invaluable skill of rapidly changing his mind when presented with new evidence, a trait powered by emotional intelligence. Jobs's ability to shift direction and let go of pride influenced Cook and many others, including Jeff Bezos, Jony Ive, and Marc Benioff.

title: Fearing Russian attack, Germany plans revamp of cold-war shelters & bunkers
content: Germany is preparing to expand its network of bunkers and shelters amid growing concerns that Russia could potentially attack a Nato country by 2029. The focus is on repurposing existing structures like tunnels and underground garages to quickly accommodate a million people.

title: Tesla Optimus chief resigns: Thanks Elon Musk in his farewell post on Twitter; says ‘You have …'
content: Milan Kovac, Tesla's Optimus robot project head, has resigned to spend more time with family abroad after nine years with the company. This transition occurs as Tesla intensifies its focus on autonomous technology and robotics. Ashok Elluswamy, currently leading Tesla’s Autopilot team, will assume Kovac’s responsibilities amidst challenges like rare-earth magnet export restrictions.

title: G7 Summit: Canadian journalist flags Khalistani extremism, free speech abuse
content: A Canadian journalist has voiced serious concerns about the growing presence of Khalistani extremists in Canada. This alarming situation unfolds just before the G7 Summit, where Prime Minister Modi has been invited, despite ongoing tensions between India and Canada over the issue of extremism.

title: 'It made us all jump': Lightning hits California home as 6-year-old stands nearby; watch
content: A Southern California family experienced a terrifying moment when lightning struck a nearby house while they were filming a storm. Tiffanie Buckner was recording the approaching dark clouds when a bolt hit a home in the cul-de-sac, just feet away from her daughter. The loud thunderclap caused the family to scream and run, but thankfully, no one was injured, and the house didn't catch fire.

title: 'Not the way to go': Gavaskar slams IPL's raw talent, urges focus on domestic performances
content: Sunil Gavaskar has criticised IPL teams for prioritising raw talent from state T20 leagues over proven domestic performers in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. He expressed concern that early fame and financial rewards may be affecting young players' motivation.

title: 'Great job': Trump hails National Guard for quelling LA protests; bans masks at stirs
content: Donald Trump praised the National Guard's role in handling Los Angeles immigration protests, claiming he federalized them due to local authorities' inability to manage the situation. However, mayor Karen Bass refuted the deployment. Trump also declared a ban on masks at protests, questioning protesters' motives.

title: Blackmailed with private pics, doctor kills woman in Chennai
content: In Chennai, Doctor Santosh Kumar was arrested for the murder of Nithya. Nithya blackmailed him for money. She threatened to release his private pictures. Santosh gave her sedative-laced alcohol. He then smothered her. He stole gold jewellery from her home. Police found the jewellery with a neighbor. They are investigating if Nithya blackmailed others.

title: Rinku Singh engagement: Priya Saroj in tears - Watch
content: Indian cricketer Rinku Singh and Samajwadi Party MP Priya Saroj celebrated their engagement in a grand ceremony in Lucknow. The emotional highlight was Priya's tearful reaction as Rinku placed the ring on her finger. The event was attended by prominent figures from cricket and politics, including Akhilesh Yadav and former cricketers, marking a memorable union.

title: 'RCB has lakhs of fans': Letter to govt shows warning was issued before stampede
content: Just hours before the fatal stampede that claimed 11 lives during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory celebration, a senior police officer warned the Karnataka government about inadequate security and potential crowd control problems. The officer's letter cautioned against holding the event at Vidhana Soudha due to massive anticipated crowds.

title: '1mm off, he could have died': Kota teen shot; bullet lodged in cheek for 5 days
content: In a remarkable case, a 17-year-old boy in Kota survived being shot in the head while playing. The bullet entered through his ear, traversed his skull, and lodged in his cheek for five days. Doctors successfully removed the bullet, marveling at his survival given the bullet's proximity to critical blood vessels. The incident is under police investigation.

title: ‘Tone could’ve been more measured’: Goa minister defends GMC outburst
content: Goa's Health Minister, Vishwajit Rane, addressed criticism after publicly reprimanding a Goa Medical College chief medical officer. While admitting his tone was excessive and promising to avoid similar approaches, Rane defended his intervention, citing a patient denied care.

title: Wayne Gretzky sparks controversy by accusing Florida Panthers of buying success with tax loopholes
content: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky sparked debate by highlighting financial disparities in the NHL, suggesting that teams in states with no income tax, like the Florida Panthers, have an unfair advantage in attracting talent. Gretzky emphasized the allure of traditional hockey markets like Edmonton, contrasting them with the financial benefits of playing in Florida.

title: Musk’s 'abnormal behavior' linked to hypomania, says Dr. Drew Pinsky; know what it is
content: Doctor Drew suggests Elon Musk may have hypomania. Hypomania includes elevated mood and hyperactivity. It differs from mania. Genetics, imbalance of chemicals, stress, and less sleep can cause it. Symptoms include less sleep, rapid speech, and risk-taking. Hypomania can cause burnout and strained relations. Diagnosis involves psychiatric evaluation. Treatment includes medication, therapy, and lifestyle changes.

title: RCB celebration tragedy: Gavaskar mourns victims; says 'if they had won it earlier ...'
content: Sunil Gavaskar expressed grief over the Bengaluru stadium stampede that killed 11 during RCB's IPL celebration. He acknowledged the intense emotions of RCB fans after 18 years of waiting, noting their slogan became a burden. Gavaskar empathised with fans seeking a glimpse of their heroes, highlighting the deep connection between fans and players.

title: Cash haul row: Justice Varma left with only one option
content: Justice Yashwant Varma of Allahabad High Court is facing potential impeachment during the Monsoon session due to a corruption case. A fire at his residence uncovered unaccounted cash, leading to a Supreme Court panel finding him culpable. While resignation would preserve his benefits, impeachment would strip them.

title: Who is Priya Saroj? Rinku Singh gets engaged, all you need to know
content: Cricketer Rinku Singh and MP Priya Saroj celebrated their engagement on June 8 at a luxury hotel in Lucknow, marking a union of sports and politics. The private, star-studded event hosted over 300 guests, including prominent figures from both the cricketing and political arenas. Priya Saroj, a 25-year-old MP, represents Machhlishahr in Uttar Pradesh.

title: Trump vs Musk: Nasa, Pentagon rattled by ISS threat- officials warn space program caught in feud
content: Following a public dispute between Donald Trump and Elon Musk, NASA and the Pentagon are exploring alternative spaceflight providers. Musk's threat to halt SpaceX flights, including those to the ISS, raised concerns about relying on a single provider. NASA contacted Rocket Lab, Stoke Space, and Blue Origin, while Boeing's Starliner remains grounded.

title: 'BJP IT cell knows election dates before EC': Tejashwi Yadav
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has accused the BJP-led central government of hijacking constitutional institutions since 2014, echoing Rahul Gandhi's concerns about the Election Commission. Yadav referenced the 2020 Bihar elections, alleging irregularities in vote counting. Gandhi has accused the EC of “match-fixing” in Maharashtra polls, demanding transparency and raising concerns about electoral integrity.

title: 95 killed in fresh Israeli strikes on Gaza; Thai hostage’s body recovered
content: Israel announced the recovery of the body of Nattapong Pinta, a Thai hostage abducted from Kibbutz Nir Oz during the October 7 attack. The remains were found in Rafah during an operation against the Mujahideen Brigades, whose leader was killed in a separate strike.

title: Covid-19 in India: Active cases cross 6,000
content: India's active Covid-19 cases have surpassed 6,000, with six deaths reported in the last 24 hours. Kerala is the most affected state, followed by Gujarat, West Bengal, and Delhi. While most cases are mild and treated at home, surveillance and testing efforts are ongoing for Influenza-Like Illness (ILI) and Severe Acute Respiratory Illness (SARI) cases.

title: Watch: Elephant rescues drowning gazelle at zoo
content: A heartwarming video capturing an elephant rescuing a drowning gazelle at a zoo has gone viral, showcasing the animal's incredible compassion and intelligence. The elephant carefully used its trunk to lift the struggling gazelle from the pond, saving it from a potentially fatal situation.

title: ‘That might explain the black eye’: Did Musk get beaten up by Bessent?
content: Reports surfaced of a physical altercation between Elon Musk and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent at the White House, allegedly following a disagreement over IRS proposals. Steve Bannon claimed Musk initiated the clash, leading to a 'playground tussle' that required intervention. The incident has sparked widespread internet speculation and memes, while Bannon calls for a probe into Musk's immigration status.

title: Getting visa from Croatia Game Of Thrones: 10 IIM-Calcutta friends dream trip spoilt
content: A group of IIM Calcutta alumni planned a reunion trip to Croatia. Eleven members needed Schengen visas, applied well in advance. Only nine, including foreign citizens, could travel. Visa delays caused significant financial losses and reunion cancellation. The Croatian embassy did not respond to inquiries. Travel agents advise obtaining Schengen visas from other countries for Croatia.

title: Kash Patel explains to Joe Rogan how fentanyl became America’s opium war
content: Patel, a former national security official under Trump and the first Indian-American to lead the FBI, framed the fentanyl epidemic not as a policing issue, but as a global, coordinated attack on American infrastructure—social, generational, and institutional. With over 100,000 overdose deaths in 2024, and fentanyl now the leading cause of death for Americans aged 18 to 45, Patel argued that this is no longer about addiction. “You don’t hear about fentanyl deaths in China, India, or England,” he told Rogan. “That’s not an accident.”

title: A song of ICE and fire: How Trump's immigration raids sparked the LA riots
content: Trump’s memo referred to the protests as a “form of rebellion.” By invoking the same clause Lyndon B. Johnson once used in 1965 to protect civil rights protesters in Alabama, Trump flipped the script: this time, troops weren’t defending dissent—they were suppressing it.

title: 'This land was meant for his future': Father clings to son’s grave who died in stampede
content: A deadly stampede outside Bengaluru's M Chinnaswamy Stadium during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory celebrations claimed 11 lives and injured 75. Heart-wrenching stories emerge, including a father's inconsolable grief at his son's grave.

title: 16 arrested, multiple illegal slaughter sites uncovered across Assam: CM
content: Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma voiced strong concerns over reports of illegal cattle slaughter during Eid-ul-Zuha celebrations, warning of strict action against violators regardless of their background. Multiple cases involving cattle parts and illegal slaughter sites were uncovered across the state, leading to sixteen arrests. The crackdown underscores Assam's commitment to enforcing the Assam Cattle Preservation Act and maintaining communal harmony.

title: ‘Unfairly low prices’: India slaps anti-dumping duty on China, Japan
content: India has imposed anti-dumping duties on insoluble sulphur from China and Japan, along with vitamin-A palmitate from China, the EU, and Switzerland. This action, prompted by a DGTR investigation, aims to protect domestic manufacturers from unfairly priced imports.

title: '11 years and no press conference': Congress slams PM Modi
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi, suggesting his tenure is nearing its end and highlighting perceived failures in governance and international relations. Khera pointed to Pakistan's continued diplomatic and military gains, despite recent terror attacks, citing Chinese arms deals, investments from Azerbaijan, and financial support from the World Bank and IMF.

title: Cricket Meets Politics: Rinku Singh & Priya Saroj exchange rings; see pics
content: Indian cricketer Rinku Singh and Samajwadi Party MP Priya Saroj celebrated their engagement on June 8 at a luxurious Lucknow hotel. The event, attended by over 300 guests, featured prominent figures from cricket and politics, including Akhilesh Yadav and Jaya Bachchan. The couple exchanged rings on a grand stage after seeking blessings at a temple.

title: India’s 2011 WC-winning squad: Kohli stands alone as last active member; Chawla retires
content: Fourteen years after India's 2011 World Cup victory, Virat Kohli remains the sole active player from that iconic squad, following Piyush Chawla's recent retirement. The departure of Chawla marks the end of an era, with legends like Dhoni, Tendulkar, and Yuvraj having already retired. Kohli's enduring presence symbolises the passage of time and the legacy of India's cherished triumph.

title: India's auto industry seeks govt help on rare earth magnet imports from China
content: The Indian automobile industry is seeking government intervention to expedite Chinese approvals for rare earth magnet imports, crucial for electric vehicles and car components. Restrictions imposed by China on rare earth element exports are causing supply chain disruptions. Automakers are exploring alternatives, but immediate solutions are limited, potentially leading to production delays and increased costs.

title: Ex-convict who killed 5 in 1993 held again in Bikaner; had built temple on govt land
content: Bikaner police have arrested Shribhagwan, a 50-year-old man, for allegedly raping two minor sisters, aged 7 and 9. Investigations revealed a disturbing past, as Shribhagwan was previously convicted of murdering five family members during a 1993 robbery. Released in 2013, he lured the girls with promises before the assault, threatening them afterward.

title: CM Stalin daydreams of winning over 200 seats in 2026 Assembly election: Edappadi Palaniswami
content: More political parties will join the AIADMK coalition soon, strengthening its alliance, said the AIADMK leader

title: Active COVID-19 cases in India cross 6,000-mark
content: Kerala continues to be the most affected state, followed by Gujarat, West Bengal and Delhi, according to the ministry.

title: Local people find a tiger and dog trapped in a composting pit in a cardamom plantation in Idukki
content: According to Kottayam Divisional Forest Officer (DFO) N. Rajesh, the tiger may have chased the dog, causing both animals to accidentally plunge into the steep and circular trench

title: Andhra Pradesh Governor Abdul Nazeer congratulates athlete Jyothi Yarraji
content: Andhra Pradesh Governor Abdul Nazeer said Jyothi Yarraji made the people of Andhra Pradesh as well as the nation proud with her achievement

title: Assam flood situation improves, 3.37 lakh in 12 districts affected
content: An official bulletin said that the total death toll in this year’s floods and landslides is at 23, including six killed in mudslides, till Saturday

title: How maths helped identify fake paintings and other matters
content: Eight decades ago, G.H. Hardy wrote in his classic A Mathematician’s Apology, “ A mathematician, like a painter or a poet, is a maker of patterns. If his patterns are more permanent than theirs, it is because they are made with ideas”

title: Bengaluru stampede: Police flagged lack of time to prepare and make security arrangements, document shows
content: This letter is the only document that shows the State government overruled concerns raised by the Bengaluru City Police and went ahead with RCB victory celebrations.

title: Arrest of Arambai Tenggol leaders triggers violence in Manipur
content: Protestors have called a 10-day shutdown across the five districts of Imphal Valley after the government suspended Internet services and imposed restrictions

title: 28 stranded people, 20 Army personnel airlifted from landslide-hit Chaten in north Sikkim
content: Responding to distress calls from a few locals and some taxi drivers seeking evacuation, the government hired the chopper to rescue them from Chaten in north Sikkim

title: Tirupati laddu row: Kiran Rayal demands arrest of TTD former Executive Officer Dharma Reddy
content: The JSP leader announced to write a letter to CM and Deputy CM to probe into Dharma Reddy’s role in ghee adulteration

title: NDA government redefined women-led development in 11 years: PM Modi
content: In all sectors, including science, education, sports, start ups and the armed forces, women are excelling and inspiring several people, Mr. Modi said

title: Andhra Pradesh teachers’ transfers, promotions in online mode to ensure transparency and efficiency: official
content: Transition to online counselling for teacher promotions and transfers addresses inefficiency, transparency issues, and inequity in manual processes

title: Onset of monsoon over Jharkhand likely around mid-June
content: The monsoon hit Kerala on May 24 this year, a week ahead of schedule. Normally, the southwest monsoon makes its onset over Kerala by June 1 and covers the entire country by July 8

title: News in Frames | From ashes, they rise
content: Amid cross-border shelling, devastation, and displacement, the resilient people of Jammu and Kashmir endure, standing strong through the toughest times

title: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar to visit France, EU and Belgium from June 8
content: During his visit to France, Jaishankar will be participating in the inaugural edition of the Mediterranean Rasina Dialogue which is being held in Marseille.

title: Pilot meets Gehlot, invites him to programme on father's 25th death anniversary
content: Ties between Mr. Pilot and Mr. Gehlot were strained after the political crisis that hit the Ashok Gehlot-led government in 2020

title: Fadnavis steers clear of buzz over possible Thackeray, Pawar family reunions
content: Over the past few weeks, there has been a growing buzz about a possible reunion between the NCP, headed by Deputy CM Ajit Pawar, and NCP (SP), led by his uncle Sharad Pawar.

title: 15-year-old boy’s electrocution ignites political fire in Kerala’s Nilambur bypoll
content: Congress workers launched a protest accusing the government of the responsibility. They blocked the road leading to the Government Taluk Hospital at Nilambur. Police arrested and forcibly removed the protestors

title: Water dispute: HC dismisses Punjab's plea seeking recall or modification of May 6 order
content: Punjab and Haryana had been at loggerheads over the distribution of water with the AAP government refusing to share water from Bhakra Dam, saying the neighbouring State has already utilised its share of water

title: 86.5 lakh deaths in 2022, 15% dip over COVID-hit 2021: CRS data
content: The dip of 15.74 lakh from 2021 brought mortality figures broadly back in line with pre-pandemic patterns last seen in 2020

title: Dog carries newborn's body in its jaws at M.P. hospital; probe on
content: A security guard managed to retrieve the body after shooing away the dog at the civil hospital in Mhow, located 25 k.m. from the district headquarters, where the incident took place on Saturday

title: Soldiers injured in Operation Sindoor again ready to give befitting reply to Pakistan: BSF DIG
content: The DIG said the nation has full faith that her brave security forces will respond effectively, giving Pakistan such a lesson that it will never forget in its lifetime

title: Jubilee Hills MLA Maganti Gopinath passes away at 63
content: Maganti Gopinath began his political journey in 1983 with the Telugu Desam Party (TDP). The three-time MLA was also a film producer.

title: Germany reaffirms strong support to India in fight against terrorism: FM Wadephul
content: The discussions also focused on enhancing and deepening the multi-faceted India-Germany Strategic Partnership, built on a shared commitment to upholding a rules-based international order rooted in democratic values

title: TMC slams PM Modi for not giving credit to previous govts for Chenab rail bridge
content: In a series of posts on X, TMC leaders Derek O'Brien and Sagarika Ghose said former Prime Ministers Atal Bihari Vajpayee and Manmohan Singh should also be given credit for the rail bridge

title: Akhanda Godavari project bhumi puja scheduled for June 19 postponed, says Minister
content: Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan will perform bhumi pujas for Akhanda Godavari project and State Forest Academy buildings by June-end, says Kandula Durgesh

title: BJP’s previous government failed to contribute towards Himachal Pradesh’s development, says CM Sukhu
content: The party kept boasting about double engine governments but it had raised substantial loans during its five-year regime in the State, he adds

title: TDP former MLA Palla Simhachalam passes away
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu, Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan, IT Minister Nara Lokesh and other political leaders express condolences

title: Invite leaders from other parties to TDP only after a thorough check of their background: Naidu
content: The TDP national president’s advice assumes significance in the wake of his caution during Mahanadu that the party needs to be wary about the presence of coverts and criminals in its ranks, and the damage likely to be caused by them

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu calls for victory rallies on June 12 to mark one year of NDA rule in Andhra Pradesh
content: The coalition has been able to bring about a welcome change in the last one year and there is a need to sustain the positive momentum for the next four years, he tells party leaders

title: Focus is on enhancing diagnostic equipment in government hospitals, says Health Minister
content: A universal health insurance scheme providing a cover of up to ₹25 lakh will be rolled out soon, he says

title: Police complaints lodged against journalist for ‘offensive remarks’ against Amaravati women
content: A.P. Assembly Deputy Speaker also lodges a complaint with the DGP against the alleged derogatory remarks made by Krishnam Raju during a show aired in Sakshi TV

title: Telangana Cabinet expansion today likely on Sunday afternoon
content: A senior functionary told The Hindu that the All India Congress Committee has given its final nod to the list of names

title: Manipur government imposes curfew, Internet suspension in Bishnupur, four other districts
content: Internet services were suspended for five days in the five districts - Bishnupur, Imphal West, Imphal East, Thoubal and Kakching

title: Infosys gets huge relief on GST as DGGI closes ₹32,400-crore pre-show cause notice
content: The GST demand, in fact, exceeds Infosys’s annual profits — Infosys’s net profit for full FY25 stood at ₹26,713 crore — and its closure now is bound to come as a significant relief for the tech major

title: It was a calculated and premeditated operation in Maharashtra, says Ramesh Chennithala
content: Congress leader questioned the “addition of 7.6 million votes”, pointing out that the initial turnout on the polling day was 58.22%, which jumped to 66.05% overnight.

title: What is the COVID-19 situation in India? | Explained
content: What are the variants doing the rounds? What are the symptoms? Is the medical system prepared? Why are doctors stressing on the importance of taking basic preventive measures? What is the advice on vaccines and booster doses? Are people with co-morbidities and those who are immuno-compromised at greater risk from the virus?

title: Bihar had lowest sex ratio at birth in 2022, in decline for three years: CRS data
content: Only 891 girl babies were registered in Bihar in 2022, for every 1,000 boys; Maharashtra, Telangana, Gujarat also recorded low sex ratios at birth; deaths registered in 2022 dropped sharply from 2021, when COVID hit hardest

title: Gen. Anil Chauhan | A General for all seasons
content: The Chief of Defence Staff, who recently confirmed that India suffered losses on May 7 during combat with Pakistan, says the operation was a resounding success and that India’s defence compelled Islamabad to come to a truce on May 10

title: Shortage of dustbins, rampant garbage dumping plague TNUHDB tenements in Chennai
content: While residents cite the lack of dustbins for the accumulation of waste along corridors and on the ground floor, conservancy workers complain of difficult working conditions in the tenements. The Corporation will float tenders for sanitation work in TNUHDB tenements in Zones I to X

title: T.N. government enhances Kuruvai coverage in Cauvery delta to over 5 lakh acres
content: Last year, the achievement was around 3.88 lakh acres, which was about 1.7 lakh acres short of what was covered during 2023-24

title: Jackfruit fair begins in Hubballi
content: A two-day Organic Mango and Jackfruit Fair organised by Sahaja Samrudha and Rotary Club of Hubballi has begun at Bhagini Mandal in Hubballi with Chairman of Karnataka Legislative Council Basavaraj Horatti inaugurating it on Saturday.

title: Govt., Opposition trade charges over Digha Jagannath temple prasad in West Bengal
content: Sweets from local shops were being passed off as prasad from the temple, the State BJP leadership accused the West Bengal government, which refuted the allegations

title: Bihar pushes up its Ayushman Bharat health insurance coverage
content: State Government launches intensive drive to bring the poorest of the poor into the fold of assured healthcare

title: Bastar project pending for 45 years gets go ahead from PM: Chhattisgarh CM
content: PM asks CM to present ₹49,000 cr Bodhghat project to Jal Shakti Ministry; to help irrigate 7 lakh hectares, produce 125 megawatts of power; will submerge 24 villages, displace 2,000 families

title: Rahul shamelessly peddling lies on Maharashtra poll, says Nadda
content: Instead of doing introspection after poll defeat, Congress leader cooking up bizarre conspiracies, says BJP president

title: Espionage case: Punjab YouTuber remanded to police custody
content: YouTuber Jasbir Singh’s police custody extended and the lawyer says Haryana police summoned him in Jyoti Malhotra case

title: SRMIST, The Hindu to hold third webinar on multidisciplinary learning on June 10
content: Join SRMIST and The Hindu for a webinar on multidisciplinary learning for future careers on June 10 at 11.30 a.m.

title: Amit Shah in Madurai: Home Minister arrives; security beefed up in and around Meenakshi temple
content: The BJP leader is scheduled to address party functionaries as part of the Tamil Nadu BJP’s core council meeting, at a private hotel on June 8

title: Home Minister Amit Shah felicitates Chhattisgarh police officers
content: Congratulating them on the success of anti-Maoist operations, he says that the Union Government is ‘committed to freeing India from the menace of Maoism’

title: Relentless Dvalishvili taps O'Malley to retain title
content: Merab Dvalishvili kept coming at Sean O'Malley, ultimately submitting him in Round 3 to remain bantamweight champ Saturday night at UFC 316.

title: Wright reportedly won't be in mix for Knicks job
content: Former Villanova coach Jay Wright confirmed that he is not interested in the Knicks' head coaching vacancy and wishes to remain retired, according to Seth Davis.

title: Derby victor Sovereignty returns to win Belmont
content: Sovereignty bested Journalism on Saturday in a Kentucky Derby rematch to win the 157th Belmont Stakes, and the second hosted at Saratoga.

title: Sources: Rodgers with Steelers, inks $13M+ deal
content: Aaron Rodgers has signed a one-year, $13.65 million deal with the Steelers, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter, a deal that includes $10 million guaranteed.

title: Red Sox prospect Anthony hits longest HR of '25
content: Roman Anthony, ESPN's No. 1-rated prospect, smashed a 497-foot grand slam for Boston's Triple-A team Saturday night, the longest home run in affiliated baseball this season.

title: Sky deflated by 'heartbreaking' Vandersloot injury
content: Sky guard Courtney Vandersloot was carried off the court after going down with a right knee injury midway through the first quarter of Saturday's loss to the Fever.

title: Keyshawn Davis in altercation after brother's loss
content: Keyshawn Davis' nightmarish week ended in disaster Saturday night when he and his younger brother were involved in a backstage altercation following older brother Kelvin's loss to Nahir Albright.

title: Ex-MMA star Askren in hospital with severe illness
content: Former MMA champion Ben Askren was hospitalized after developing severe pneumonia, his wife posted on social media on Saturday.

title: 💬 LeBron James and more react to Gauff's win
content: Coco Gauff won her second major trophy, defeating Aryna Sabalenka in the French Open final, and social media reacted accordingly.

title: Alcaraz vs. Sinner: Who will win the  title?
content: The final we've been waiting for: Alcaraz and Sinner will face off for the French Open title. Who will prevail? Our experts weigh in.

title: 'Always competitively present': Alex Caruso's journey from G League to veteran leader
content: From G League hopeful to veteran defensive stalwart, Alex Caruso's leadership shines on one of the league's youngest teams.

title: NCAA athlete pay: Here's what's next
content: Schools will begin directly paying their athletes in less than a month, thanks to a legal settlement that was officially approved in federal court Friday. However, the situation is far from settled.

title: Turkey loss gives Poch, USMNT more questions than answers
content: In its first pre-Gold Cup tuneup, the short-handed USMNT looked no closer to fixing its uninspired play.

title: USMNT sees positives despite 3rd straight loss
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino insists his players deserved better after falling 2-1 to Turkey on Saturday to suffer a third consecutive loss.

title: Pochettino dismisses Spurs links: 'Not realistic'
content: USMNT head coach Mauricio Pochettino shut down rumors linking him to the Tottenham Hotspur managerial vacancy, labeling the idea "not realistic."

title: Sources: Liverpool return with $153m Wirtz bid
content: Liverpool have stepped up their pursuit of Florian Wirtz by lodging an improved £113m bid for the Bayer Leverkusen playmaker, sources have told ESPN.

title: Santos say Neymar tested positive for COVID-19
content: Brazil forward Neymar has been sidelined after testing positive for COVID-19, his club Santos said in a statement as quoted by Brazilian media.

title: Ronaldo 'almost certain' not to play at CWC
content: Al Nassr and Portugal forward Cristiano Ronaldo said on Saturday he did not plan to play at the Club World Cup in the United States.

title: Reijnders set for City medical ahead of transfer
content: Tijjani Reijnders will undergo a medical with Manchester City on Sunday before returning to the Netherlands national team camp later in the day.

title: Sources: Frank, Silva lead Tottenham shortlist
content: Brentford boss Thomas Frank and Fulham manager Marco Silva lead Tottenham Hotspur's shortlist to replace Ange Postecoglou, sources have told ESPN.

title: Plucked from Dunkin', QB J'Mar Smith leads the Stallions into the playoffs
content: Smith, a former Stallions signal-caller, had given up on football before a string of injuries brought about his return.

title: After Thackerays, Reunion Buzz About Another Political Family In Maharashtra

title: Canada's New Citizenship Bill: What It Means For Indians, Those Born Abroad
content: This bill is expected to benefit the Indian diaspora and other immigrant communities amid the Trump administrations tightening of immigration policies in the United States.

title: "Operational Savvy, Wicked Smart": Axiom Space On Indian Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla
content: A combat pilot for 15 years, Shubhanshu Shukla is set to become the first Indian astronaut to visit the International Space Station (ISS) on the upcoming Axiom-4 (Ax-4) mission.

title: Tourist Couple's Last 12 Hours In Meghalaya Village Before They Disappeared: What Witnesses Said
content: The 12 hours that a couple from Madhya Pradesh's Indore spent at Nongriat village in Meghalaya's East Khasi Hills during their visit to the popular double-decker living root bridge have now been accounted for.

title: Action Sought Against Karnataka Over Damage To Bengaluru Park During RCB Event

title: 9-Year-Old Girl Dies After Being Raped, Stuffed In Bag In Delhi: Cops
content: A minor girl died after she was allegedly raped and stuffed into a suitcase in a bleeding condition in Delhi's Dayalpur area, a police official said on Sunday.

title: On CCTV, 2 Men With Suitcase In Which Teen's Body Was Found Near Bengaluru
content: Nearly three weeks after a teenager's body was found stuffed inside a suitcase near railway tracks on the outskirts of Bengaluru, CCTV footage has emerged which shows two men carrying the bag.

title: Watch: Mahua Moitra's 1st Dance With Husband Pinaki Misra At Wedding

title: Judge's Mangalsutra Snatched From UP Temple, 10 Women Thieves Arrested
content: A gang of women thieves who targeted female devotees at temples in Mathura was busted in a police crackdown after a judge's mangalsutra was snatched, officials said on Sunday.

title: Gaza Aid Group Pauses Operations Over Hamas Threats - Group Denies Claims
content: Although the statement did not give information on the threats, they were directed at the foundations drivers, and at Palestinian staff who are helping with the operations at distribution sites.

title: Rahul Gandhi Made Allegations, But Sent No Letter To Election Commission: Sources
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi has not written any letter to the Election Commission of India (ECI) or sought any time for a meeting even 24 hours after he raised allegations of "rigging" in the assembly election held in November last year.

title: Little To Show Post Operation Sindoor, Pak Tries Hard Again With Doctored Images
content: Did Pakistan hit a Sukhoi-30MKI parked at Adampur air base in Punjab? Or destroy an S-400 surface-to-air missile unit at Bhuj airfield in Gujarat? Those are the two latest fantasies being pushed as part of a month-long campaign of wishful thinking.

title: Hamas-Linked Mujahideen Leaders, Who Killed Bibas Children, Neutralised
